hints.title: Coupled Swarm State
hints.content:
575: :label: def-d-coupled-state
576: 
577: A **coupled swarm state** consists of two independent swarms evolving under the same transition kernel:
578: 
579: $$
580: (S_1, S_2) \in (\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \times \{0,1\})^{2N}
581: $$
hints.raw_directive:
572: To prove geometric ergodicity, we must show that **two independent copies** of the swarm converge to each other. This requires a Lyapunov function on the **coupled state space**.
573: 
574: :::{prf:definition} Coupled Swarm State
575: :label: def-d-coupled-state
576: 
577: A **coupled swarm state** consists of two independent swarms evolving under the same transition kernel:
578: 
579: $$
580: (S_1, S_2) \in (\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \times \{0,1\})^{2N}
581: $$
582:

hints.label: def-d-coupled-lyapunov
hints.title: Coupled Lyapunov Function (from `03_cloning.md` and `04_convergence.md`)
hints.content:
587: :label: def-d-coupled-lyapunov
588: 
589: The **total Lyapunov function** is:
590: 
591: $$
592: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = c_V V_{\text{inter}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B V_{\text{boundary}}(S_1, S_2)
593: $$
594: 
595: where $c_V, c_B > 0$ are **coupling constants** to be chosen.
596: 
597: **Inter-Swarm Component:**
598: 
599: $$
600: V_{\text{inter}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) + V_{\text{Var},v}(S_1, S_2)
601: $$
602: 
603: where:
604: 
605: **1. Wasserstein-2 Distance** (with hypocoercive cost):
606: 
607: $$
608: V_W(S_1, S_2) = W_h^2(\mu_1, \mu_2)
609: $$
610: 
611: where $\mu_k$ is the empirical measure of alive walkers in swarm $k$, and $W_h$ is the Wasserstein-2 distance with respect to the **hypocoercive norm** (defined in Section 3.2):
612: 
613: $$
614: \|((\Delta x, \Delta v))\|_h^2 = \|\Delta x\|^2 + \lambda_v \|\Delta v\|^2 + b \langle \Delta x, \Delta v \rangle
615: $$
616: 
617: **2. Position Variance Sum:**
618: 
619: $$
620: V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) = V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1) + V_{\text{Var},x}(S_2)
621: $$
622: 
623: where $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_k) = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i: s_{k,i}=1} \|x_{k,i} - \bar{x}_k\|^2$.
624: 
625: :::{admonition} Normalization by $N$ (not $N_{\text{alive}}$)
626: :class: note

hints.label: thm-main-convergence
hints.title: Geometric Ergodicity of the Adaptive Gas
hints.content:
666: :label: thm-main-convergence
667: 
668: Consider the Adaptive Gas with:
669: 1. Adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$ satisfying uniform ellipticity (Theorem [](#thm-uniform-ellipticity))
670: 2. Confining potential $U(x)$ satisfying coercivity (Axiom 1.3.1 from `04_convergence.md`)
671: 3. Regularization $\epsilon_\Sigma > 0$ large enough that $c_{\min} \ge c_{\min}^*$ for some threshold $c_{\min}^*$
672: 
673: Then there exist coupling constants $c_V, c_B > 0$ and **N-uniform** constants $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$, $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$ such that:
674: 
675: **1. Foster-Lyapunov Condition:**
676: 
677: $$
678: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(S_1', S_2') \mid S_1, S_2] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{total}}
679: $$
680: 
681: for all coupled states $(S_1, S_2)$ with $N_{\text{alive},k}(S_k) \ge 1$.
682: 
683: **2. Geometric Ergodicity:**
684: 
685: There exists a unique quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ such that:
686: 
687: $$
688: \left\| \mathcal{L}(S_t \mid S_0) - \pi_{\text{QSD}} \right\|_{\text{TV}} \le C_\pi (1 + V_{\text{total}}(S_0, S_0)) \rho^t
689: $$
690: 
691: where $\rho = 1 - \kappa_{\text{total}} < 1$ and $C_\pi < \infty$ are **independent of $N$**.
692: 
693: **3. Explicit Rate:**
694: 
695: $$
696: \kappa_{\text{total}} = O\left(\min\left\{\gamma \tau, \, \kappa_x^{\text{clone}}, \, c_{\min}\right\}\right)
697: $$
698: 
699: where:
700: - $\gamma \tau$ is the kinetic contraction rate (friction × timestep)
hints.raw_directive:
663: ### 2.2. Main Convergence Theorem
664: 
665: :::{prf:theorem} Geometric Ergodicity of the Adaptive Gas
666: :label: thm-main-convergence
667: 
668: Consider the Adaptive Gas with:
669: 1. Adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$ satisfying uniform ellipticity (Theorem [](#thm-uniform-ellipticity))
670: 2. Confining potential $U(x)$ satisfying coercivity (Axiom 1.3.1 from `04_convergence.md`)
671: 3. Regularization $\epsilon_\Sigma > 0$ large enough that $c_{\min} \ge c_{\min}^*$ for some threshold $c_{\min}^*$
672: 
673: Then there exist coupling constants $c_V, c_B > 0$ and **N-uniform** constants $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$, $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$ such that:
674: 
675: **1. Foster-Lyapunov Condition:**
676: 
677: $$
678: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(S_1', S_2') \mid S_1, S_2] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{total}}
679: $$
680: 
681: for all coupled states $(S_1, S_2)$ with $N_{\text{alive},k}(S_k) \ge 1$.
682: 
683: **2. Geometric Ergodicity:**
684: 
685: There exists a unique quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ such that:
686: 
687: $$
688: \left\| \mathcal{L}(S_t \mid S_0) - \pi_{\text{QSD}} \right\|_{\text{TV}} \le C_\pi (1 + V_{\text{total}}(S_0, S_0)) \rho^t
689: $$
690: 
691: where $\rho = 1 - \kappa_{\text{total}} < 1$ and $C_\pi < \infty$ are **independent of $N$**.
692: 
693: **3. Explicit Rate:**
694: 
695: $$
696: \kappa_{\text{total}} = O\left(\min\left\{\gamma \tau, \, \kappa_x^{\text{clone}}, \, c_{\min}\right\}\right)
697: $$
698: 
699: where:
700: - $\gamma \tau$ is the kinetic contraction rate (friction × timestep)
701: - $\kappa_x^{\text{clone}}$ is the cloning position variance contraction rate (from `03_cloning.md`)
